greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) is the number of size k ordered submultisets of the regular multiset {1_1,1_2,...,1_(n-1),1_n, ... ,i_1,i_2,...,i_(n-1),i_n, ... ,n_1,n_2,...,n_(n-1),n_n} (which contains n copies of i for 1 <= i <= n).
comment: A181567 gives the case for unordered submultisets.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..26, flattened
Thomas Wieder, Maple program for A234574
example: For n=2 we have the regular multiset L = [1,1,2,2].
We get the following ordered submultisets from L:
maple: # first Maple program: see link above
b:= proc(n, k, i) option remember; `if`(k=0, 1,
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n^2), n=0..5); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 04 2016
results.author: _Thomas Wieder_, Dec 29 2013
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 04 2016
